Programming in the Large --- Assignment 1, Semester 2, 2024

SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AddressBook
The address book where the farmer stores their customers' details.
Barcode
Collection of constant barcodes representing all product types a farm can choose to stock.
BasicInventory
A very basic inventory that both stores and handles products individually.
Cart
A shopping cart that stores the customer products until they check out.
CategorisedTransaction
A transaction that keeps track of what was purchased and by whom.
Customer
A customer who interacts with the farmer's business.
CustomerNotFoundException
Thrown if a customer is not found when looked up.
DuplicateCustomerException
Thrown if a customer attempting to be added, when there is already a customer with those details.
Egg
A class representing an instance of an egg.
FailedTransactionException
Thrown if a transaction is failed.
FancyInventory
A fancy inventory which stores products in stacks, enabling quantity information.
Farm
Top-level model class responsible for storing and making updates to the data and smaller model entities that make up the internal state of a farm.
FarmManager
Controller class, coordinating information between the model and view/UI of the program.
InvalidStockRequestException
Thrown if attempting to perform a stock operation with invalid parameters.
Inventory
An interface representing the base requirements for an Inventory.
Jam
A class representing an instance of jam.
Main
 
Milk
A class representing an instance of milk.
Product
An abstract class representing an instance of a product.
Quality
Quality ratings given to products in the farm's inventory.
ReceiptPrinter
Utility class for pretty-printing a transaction as a receipt.
ShopFront
The user interface for the farm program.
SpecialSaleTransaction
A transaction that keeps track of what was purchased and by whom.
Transaction
A transaction that keeps track of what was purchased and by whom.
TransactionHistory
A record of all past transactions.
TransactionManager
The controlling class for all transactions.
Wool
A class representing an instance of wool.
